thread.title: DPS: Southbound Interstate 17 closed after carjacking suspect shoots at troopers, is injured in crash
thread.title_full: DPS: Southbound Interstate 17 closed after carjacking suspect shoots at troopers, is injured in crash

author: Yihyun Jeong and Meghan Finnerty , The Republic | azcentral.com
title: DPS: Southbound Interstate 17 closed after carjacking suspect shoots at troopers, is injured in crash
text:
Arizona Department of Public Safety Director Frank Milstead said a suspect was firing at troopers before the crash occurred. Breaking news. (Photo: The Republic | azcentral.com) 
9 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE A crash involving a carjacking suspect who shot at officers shut down southbound Interstate 17 near Munds Park on Sunday afternoon, authorities said.
Our detectives, troopers & Yavapai Co. deputies are investigating two crime scenes southbound along #I17 between Munds Park & Camp Verde. pic.twitter.com/l2GgFF6VAQ 
— Dept. Public Safety (@Arizona_DPS) February 12, 2017 Arizona Department of Public Safety Director Col. Frank Milstead said a suspect was firing at troopers before the crash occurred. The suspect was injured in the crash and no troopers were injured, the DPS said.
The DPS received reports that a red Mustang was driving recklessly southbound on Interstate 17 before 10 a.m. The Mustang crashed with another vehicle, and the Mustang driver, armed with a rifle, left his car and carjacked a white GMC sport-utility vehicle, the DPS said.
Troopers pursued the stolen vehicle, and officials said the suspect fired at troopers during the chase. The suspect crashed the SUV in a head-on collision with a semi truck driving southbound on Interstate 17, about 15 miles south of Munds Park, according to the DPS.
The suspect was flown to a hospital with life-threatening injuries. The updated information provided in a DPS press release this afternoon corrected Milstead's earlier report that the suspect died in the crash.
All Law Enforcement officers involved are OK. Suspect is deceased from fatal crash.
— Col. Frank Milstead (@frank_milstead) February 12, 2017 Lanes were closed at about 10:30 a.m. with no estimate on when they will reopen, the Arizona Department of Transportation said.
I-17 SB remains CLOSED 23 miles south of Flagstaff. Alt. route from I-40 EB is SR 89 to SR 69. I-40 WB use SR 87 to SR 260 to I-17. pic.twitter.com/u4HUoNHf9Y 
— Arizona DOT (@ArizonaDOT) February 12, 2017 ADOT told people driving on westbound Interstate 40 to use State Route 87 at Winslow, south to State Route 260 to I-17 as an alternative route. Those driving eastbound on I-40 were asked to use State Route 89 to State Route 69.
SR 89A southbound at Sedona is backed up for 5 to 6 miles into Oak Creek Canyon. #aztraffic pic.twitter.com/t5HBK5jvRw 
— Arizona DOT (@ArizonaDOT) February 12, 2017 Check back with azcentral.com for more details.
